panels.description: amount of CQL connections currently established
panels.title: Client CQL connections by [[by]]

panels.description: Number of CQL batches command, each batched command is counted once
panels.title: CQL Batches by [[by]]

panels.description: Number of CQL command batched. Each batch would add the number of commands inside the batch
panels.title: CQL Command In Batches by [[by]]

panels.description:
All of the requests should be prepared

Prepared statements remove the overhead of parsing the query every time and allow optimal routing of requests from client to server

targets.expr: floor(100 *sum(rate(scylla_query_processor_statements_prepared{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s])) /(sum(rate(scylla_cql_reads{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s])) + sum(rate(scylla_cql_inserts{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s])) + sum(rate(scylla_cql_updates{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s])) + sum(rate(scylla_cql_deletes{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s])))) OR vector(0)

panels.title: CQL Non-Prepared Statements

panels.description: All of the requests should be prepared
panels.title: CQL Non-Prepared Statements

panels.description:
All requests should be paged

Non Paged request sources:
- Client modifying the fetch size

Non Paged requests require reading all the results and returning them in a single request.
panels.title: Non-Paged CQL Reads

panels.description: Non-Paged requests require reading all the results and returning them in a single request
panels.title: Non-Paged CQL Reads

panels.description:
All of the requests should be Token Aware

Non Token Aware requests sources:
* Non-Prepared Stamements
* Client not using a Token Aware load balancing policy

TokenAware requests are sent to a Scylla node that is also a replica. Token Un-Aware requests require extra hop and additional processing.

Note that the metric shows incorrect values when batches are used.

targets.expr: 100 - floor(100*(sum(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_reads_local_node{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s])) +sum(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_total_write_attempts_local_node{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s])))/(sum(rate(scylla_cql_inserts{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s]) + rate(scylla_cql_updates{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s]) + rate(scylla_cql_deletes{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s]) + rate(scylla_cql_reads{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s])))) OR vector(0)

panels.title: Non-Token Aware

panels.description:
Requests that are not token aware indicates that requests are not routed to the right node, which require extra hop and additional processing.

Note that the metric shows incorrect values when batches are used.

targets.expr: sum(irate(scylla_cql_reads{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s])) by ([[by]]) - sum(irate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_reads_local_node{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s])) by ([[by]]) + sum(irate(scylla_cql_inserts{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s]) + irate(scylla_cql_updates{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s]) + irate(scylla_cql_deletes{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s])) by ([[by]]) - sum(irate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_total_write_attempts_local_node{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s])) by ([[by]])

panels.title: Non-Token Aware Queries

panels.description:
Reversed CQL Reads entail additional processing on server side

Sources: CQL Read requests with ORDER BY that is different from the "CLUSTERING ORDER BY" of the table
Alternatives:

* Denormalize your data (use a Materialized View)

targets.expr: 100 * sum(rate(scylla_cql_reverse_queries{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s])) / sum(rate(scylla_cql_reads{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s])) OR vector(0)

panels.title: Reversed CQL Reads

panels.description: Reversed CQL Reads entail additional processing on server side and should be avoided
panels.title: Reversed CQL Reads

panels.description:
ALLOW FILTERING CQL Reads, the percentage of read requests with 'ALLOW FILTERING'

ALLOW FILTERING CQL Reads entail additional processing on server side

Sources: CQL Read requests with "ALLOW FILTERING"

ALLOW FILTERING should be used when large parts of the filtered data is returned - check 
"ALLOW FILTERING CQL Read Filtered Rows to check what percentage of the data is used"

Alternatives:
- Use a Secondary Index
- Denormalize your data (use a Materialized View)

targets.expr: 100 * sum(rate(scylla_cql_filtered_read_requests{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s])) / sum(rate(scylla_cql_reads{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s])) OR vector(0)

panels.title: ALLOW FILTERING CQL Reads

panels.description:
Read requests with ALLOW FILTERING

ALLOW FILTERING CQL Reads entail additional processing on server side and should be avoided
panels.title: ALLOW FILTERING CQL Reads

panels.description:
ALLOW FILTERING Filtered rows, the percentage of rows that were read and then filtered.

ALLOW FILTERING CQL Reads entail additional processing on server side. 
Reading a row and then filter it is a waste of resources.

Sources: CQL Read requests with "ALLOW FILTERING"

ALLOW FILTERING should be used when large parts of the filtered data is returned

Alternatives:
- Use a Secondary Index
- Denormalize your data (use a Materialized View)

targets.expr: 100 * sum(rate(scylla_cql_filtered_rows_dropped_total{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s]))  /sum(rate(scylla_cql_filtered_rows_read_total{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s])) OR vector(0)

panels.title: ALLOW FILTERING Filtered Rows

panels.description:
CQL Queries with ALLOW FILTERING should be avoided.
Dropped rows are rows that were read but were filtered by the server.
When dropped rows is relatively high you should consider the alternatives
panels.title: ALLOW FILTERING CQL Read Filtering

panels.description: Using consistency level ANY in a query may hurt persistency, if the node receiving the request will fail the data may be lost

targets.expr: floor(100 *sum(delta(scylla_query_processor_queries{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]", consistency_level="ANY"}[60s]))/sum(delta(scylla_query_processor_queries{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s]))) OR vector(0)

panels.title: CQL ANY Queries

panels.description: Using consistency level ANY in a query may hurt persistency, if the node receiving the request will fail the data may be lost
panels.title: CQL ANY CL Queries

panels.description: Using consistency level ALL in a query may hurt availability, if a node is unavailable operations will fail

targets.expr: floor(100 *sum(delta(scylla_query_processor_queries{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]", consistency_level="ALL"}[60s]))/sum(delta(scylla_query_processor_queries{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s]))) OR vector(0)

panels.title: CQL ALL CL Queries

panels.description: Using consistency level ALL in a query may hurt availability, if a node is unavailable operations will fail
panels.title: CQL ALL CL Queries

panels.description: Using consistency level ONE in a query when there is more than one DC may hurt performance, queries may end in the non-local DC. Use LOCAL_ONE instead

targets.expr: floor(100 *sum(delta(scylla_query_processor_queries{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]", consistency_level="ONE"}[60s]))/sum(delta(scylla_query_processor_queries{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s]))) OR vector(0)

panels.title: CQL ONE Queries

panels.description: Using consistency level ONE in a query when there is more than one DC may hurt performance, queries may end in the non-local DC. Use LOCAL_ONE instead
panels.title: CQL ONE CL Queries

panels.description: Using consistency level QUORUM in a query when there is more than one DC may hurt performance, queries may end in the non-local DC. Use LOCAL_QUORUM instead

targets.expr: floor(100 *sum(delta(scylla_query_processor_queries{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]", consistency_level="QUORUM"}[60s]))/sum(delta(scylla_query_processor_queries{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s]))) OR vector(0)

panels.title: CQL QUORUM CL Queries

panels.description: Using consistency level QUORUM in a query when there is more than one DC may hurt performance, queries may end in the non-local DC. Use LOCAL_QUORUM instead
panels.title: CQL QUORUM CL Queries

panels.description:
Cross DC traffic may cause additional latencies and network loads and in most cases, should be avoided.

Cross DC Read requests sources:
- Consistency Level that is not LOCAL_XXX
- Tables with read_repair_chance > 0

Note:
- If requests are supposed to be  DC local - verify client is using a DCAware policy and a LOCAL_XX consistency level

targets.expr: 100*(sum(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_reads_remote_node{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s])) - sum(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_reads_remote_node{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", datacenter=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s])))/sum(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_reads_remote_node{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[60s])) OR vector(0)

panels.title: Cross DC read requests $dc
